intro: Zephyranthes filifolia, commonly known as the threadleaf rain lily, is a flowering plant native to the tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, strap-like leaves and showy, white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically blooms in response to rainfall, making it a symbol of the rainy season in its native habitats. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often growing in open grasslands or along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and ease of cultivation, it is popular among gardeners and botanists alike.
